uni.joel.deckard.logic

Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • uni.joel.deckard.logic.Hand

  • public class Hand
extends Object
    A player in a battle has a hand composed of a few cards. These are the cards they can next use in battle.
    Author:
    Joel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      ArrayList<Card> cards
      The cards in the hand as an ArrayList.
      static int DEFAULTSIZE 
      static int MAXHANDSIZE
      The maximum amount of cards a player can have in their hand at once.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      Constructor for Hand.

        public static final int MAXHANDSIZE
        The maximum amount of cards a player can have in their hand at once.
        See Also:

        The cards in the hand as an ArrayList.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand()
        Constructor for Hand. Creates a new empty ArrayList;

    • Method Detail

      • addCard

        public boolean addCard(Card card)
        Adds the given card to the hand. Does not add the card if the MAXHANDSIZE would be exceeded.
        Parameters:
        card - The given card.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the card was added to the hand, and false otherwise.

      • removeCard

        public void removeCard(Card card)
        Removes one of the given card from the hand. Does nothing if no amount of given card is in the hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The card, one of which should be removed.

      • containsCard

        public boolean containsCard(Card card)
        Tells if there is any of the given card in the hand.
        Parameters:
        card - The card being asked about.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one of the given card, false otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Tells how many cards are in the hand.
        Returns:
        The amount of cards in the hand.

      • getCards

        public ArrayList<Card> getCards()

      • setCards

        public void setCards(ArrayList<Card> cards)
